meeting_annotations.speaker: Shankar Mukherji
meeting_annotations.transcript: I could throw something out there. So one question that we worry about a lot in this context is the degree to which these compartments either buffer or sensitize the cell as a whole to internal or external cues. This inter-compartmental communication.
meeting_annotations.screenshare_content: None
meeting_annotations.other: He is the first to volunteer a scientific idea, effectively starting the brainstorming.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Shankar Mukherji
meeting_annotations.transcript: Like so you can imagine two really different pictures. One is where the interactions actually maybe have bypasses where if you break a link somewhere in this network, there's a bypass around it and the inner compartmental connections actually help make the cell robust. Or you can imagine the total opposite where these things are really intricately wired up with each other and if you break a link, it kills the whole system and the whole thing falls apart. So that's a dichotomy we think about a lot.
meeting_annotations.screenshare_content: None
meeting_annotations.other: He presents a clear dichotomy (robustness vs. fragility) to frame the problem.

meeting_annotations.speaker: Martin Gruebele
